About Us

The Wadhwani Institute for Artificial Intelligence aims to build and deploy AI solutions to benefit underserved populations in developing countries.

Our Work

Agriculture

Our solution helps reduce crop losses through integrated pest management in cotton farms.

Health

  • Tuberculosis: Automated reading of TB LPA test results and providing differentiated interventions for TB patients.
  • Maternal, Newborn, and Child Health: Smartphone-based anthropometry technology to track baby weight in rural homes and hospital settings.
  • COVID-19: Epidemiological forecasting and research on signature patterns for COVID-19 using cough sounds.

Vision

We believe using AI to solve problems at the bottom of the pyramid can lead to a better, more equitable world for all. Our systems aim to be sustainable and scalable, transforming the lives of billions.

“AI technology is the natural tool for leveraging this vast scaleup in the quantity and breadth of data into actionable machine learning models that direct on-the-ground interventions for underserved populations.” – Alpan Raval, Chief Scientist, AI/ML

Approach

Our approach involves a long-term commitment to use AI for good, working closely with partner organizations to create a conducive environment for defining problem areas and developing and implementing solutions – a process we define as ‘AI-readiness’.

Gallery

); } export default About;
